images.caption: Figure 1:Overview ofWebOperator, a tree-search framework for solving web tasks. The workflow iteratively explores the web environment via a structured tree: it (1) initializes at the start page, (2) observes and encodes the current page state as a node in the search tree, (3) adapts action space using the current observation, and expands the node by generating candidate actions using varied contextual formulations, and these actions are validated through rule-based analysis and simple URL-existence checks; (4) evaluates actions with a reward model, (5) merges duplicate or equivalent actions, (6) updates the search tree, (7) selects the best unexecuted action using action-aware criteria, (8) restores the target state usingspeculative backtracking, (9) executes the selected action, and (10) repeats until a terminating action produces a complete solution trajectory. Theleft panelshows an example thought–action sequence produced during task execution, andtheright paneldetails the speculative backtracking mechanism. A detailed step-by-step example of the tree search is provided in Appendix (Figure8).
Figure 2:Illustration of destructive action execution in WebOperator
Figure 3:Different types of Backtracking visualization. See AppendixDfor a detailed comparison.
Figure 4:Distribution of successful WebArena tasks grouped by the number of backtracks required across different task domains.

Figure 5:Comparison of number of destructive actions detected by pre- and post-execution heuristic across different task domains.(Map is excluded since destructive action is not applicable for read-only websites).
Figure 7:Pivotal node and its context in the accessibility tree
Figure 8:Step-by-step tree search corresponding to the overview in Figure1(Task: webarena.421).

Figure 9:Filling up the URL field in reddit submission page, leads to ”500 Internal Server Error”. Which is really hard to understand because the error is not immediate. Agent first fills up URL field, then title, then body and finally submits the post. And then gets the error. So, it is hard to know which step causes the error. Agent tries this again and again, and eventually fails.
